history.proof: intros H. induction ll. - constructor. - simpl in *. destruct (f a) eqn:E. + sauto lq: on depth: 3. + apply IHll. sauto lq: on depth: 3.

exceptions.exn: In environment X : Type P : X -> Prop f : X -> bool a : X ll : list X IHll : Forall P ll -> Forall P (filter f ll) E : f a = true Unable to unify "Forall P (filter f ll)" with "P a".
[Focus] Wrong bullet +: Current bullet + is not finished.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
P: X -> Prop
f: X -> bool
ll: list X

Goal:
Forall P ll -> Forall P (filter f ll)

Premises:
Forall : forall A : Type, (A -> Prop) -> list A -> Prop
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
filter : forall A : Type, (A -> bool) -> list A -> list A
Forall_map : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (P : Y -> Prop) (ll : list X), Forall P (map f ll) < -> Forall (fun x : X => P (f x)) ll
Forall_impl : forall (X : Type) (P Q : X -> Prop) (ll : list X), (forall x : X, In x ll -> P x -> Q x) -> Forall P ll -> Forall Q ll
Forall_rev : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (ll : list X), Forall P ll -> Forall P (rev ll)
Forall_app : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (ll mm : list X), Forall P (ll ++ mm) < -> Forall P ll /\ Forall P mm
Forall2_Forall : forall (X : Type) (R : X -> X -> Prop) (ll : list X), Forall2 R ll ll < -> Forall (fun x : X => R x x) ll
Forall_cons_inv : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (x : X) (ll : list X), Forall P (x :: ll) < -> P x /\ Forall P ll
Forall_forall_map : forall (X : Type) (f : nat -> X) (n : nat) (l : list X) (P : X -> Prop), l = map f (list_an 0 n) -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> P (f i)) < -> Forall P l
Forall_cons : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> Forall P (x :: l)
incl_Forall : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l1 l2 : list A), incl l2 l1 -> Forall P l1 -> Forall P l2
List.Forall_rev : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l -> Forall P (rev l)
Forall_and : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l -> Forall Q l -> Forall (fun x : A => P x /\ Q x) l
Forall_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : list A -> SProp), P0 nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> P0 l -> P0 (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> P0 l
Forall_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : list A -> Prop), P0 nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> P0 l -> P0 (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> P0 l
List.Forall_impl : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop), (forall a : A, P a -> Q a) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> Forall Q l
Forall_inv_tail : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (a : A) (l : list A), Forall P (a :: l) -> Forall P l
List.Forall_app : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l1 l2 : list A), Forall P (l1 ++ l2) < -> Forall P l1 /\ Forall P l2
Forall_and_inv : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall (fun x : A => P x /\ Q x) l -> Forall P l /\ Forall Q l
ForallOrdPairs_sind : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), Forall (R a) l -> ForallOrdPairs R l -> P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, ForallOrdPairs R l -> P l
ForallOrdPairs_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), Forall (R a) l -> ForallOrdPairs R l -> P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, ForallOrdPairs R l -> P l
Forall_inv : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (a : A) (l : list A), Forall P (a :: l) -> P a
neg_Forall_Exists_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> ~ Forall P l -> Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l
Forall_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (Q : list A -> Type), Q nil -> (forall (b : A) (l : list A), P b -> Q (b :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> Q l
Forall_elt : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), Forall P (l1 ++ a :: l2) -> P a
Forall_forall : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l < -> (forall x : A, In x l -> P x)
Forall_dec : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> forall l : list A, {Forall P l} + {~ Forall P l}

```coq
intros H.
induction ll.
- constructor.
- simpl in *. destruct (f a) eqn:E.
  + apply Forall_cons. destruct H. auto. apply IHll. auto.
  + apply IHll. auto.
Qed.
```

original: intros H. induction ll. - constructor. - simpl in *. destruct (f a) eqn:E. + apply Forall_cons. destruct H. auto. apply IHll. auto. + apply IHll. auto.
